text: Frank W. Bolle (June 23, 1924 â€“ May 12, 2020) was an American comic-strip artist, comic book artist and illustrator. He was best known as the longtime artist of the newspaper strips Winnie Winkle and The Heart of Juliet Jones. He also drew for comic books Tim Holt and Doctor Solar, Man of the Atom. He was the illustrator for the Boy Scouts of America magazine Boys' Life for 18 years. Bolle died May 12, 2020 in Weston, Connecticut at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American comics artists Category:American illustrators
title: Frank Bolle
